sentences.en: Barry resigned his directorship in December 1973.
sentences.cn: 巴里于1973年12月辞去了他的董事之职。

sentences.en: Has directorship for many different profit & non - profit organizations.
sentences.cn: 已董事许多不同的盈利 及 非盈利 性组织.

sentences.en: He is grooming his son for the directorship of the firm.
sentences.cn: 他在准备让他儿子担任公司的董事职务.

sentences.en: He is offerred a directorship with Smith Ltd.
sentences.cn: 史密斯有限公司请他出任董事.

sentences.en: He is shooting at the directorship.
sentences.cn: 他力图得到厂长的职位.

sentences.en: He resigned his directorship and left the firm.
sentences.cn: 他放弃了董事职务,离开了公司.

sentences.en: He will retire from his directorship next year.
sentences.cn: 他明年从主管职位上退休。

sentences.en: He will retire from the army / his directorship next year.
sentences.cn: 他明年从部队退役[从主管职位上退休].

sentences.en: It'soon became clear that he was aiming for a directorship.
sentences.cn: 他想当厂长的意图很快就看清了.

sentences.en: James is flying high now that he's got his directorship.
sentences.cn: 詹姆斯已获得处长的职位,他正平步青云呢.

sentences.en: Mr. X has been named for the directorship.
sentences.cn: 某先生已被提名担任董事职务.

sentences.en: Ms X has been named for the directorship / named as the new director.
sentences.cn: 某女士已被提名任董事职务[任命为新董事].

sentences.en: Resource dependency theory can also help to explain interlocking directorship.
sentences.cn: 资源依靠理论还有助于解释连锁董事制的必要性.

sentences.en: The young woman has been named for the directorship.
sentences.cn: 这位年轻妇女已被提名担任董事职务.

words.tran_cn: 直接的；直系的；亲身的；恰好的
定向的；经指导的；被控制的
直接地；正好；按直系关系
主任，主管；导演；人事助理
指导；管理（direct的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tran_en: the position of being a director of a company or organization
